Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge erred in applying a strict physical presence test under s 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act
Application_Facts: Applicant was 57 days short of the required 1,095 days of physical presence in Canada over four years
Decision_Outcome: Denial of citizenship application due to insufficient physical presence
Remedy_Requested: Reconsideration of residency based on contextual factors
Court_Ruling: Federal Court found the judge's decision unreasonable
Defendant_Behavior: Citizenship Judge applied a strict physical presence test without considering exceptional circumstances
Grounds_for_Claim: Failure to consider contextual factors such as family ties and economic contributions
Assessment_Factor: Physical presence, family ties, economic contributions, exceptional circumstances
Procedural_Issue: Appeal from Citizenship Judge to Federal Court
Evidence_Used: Record of physical presence, family and economic ties to Canada
Application_Basis: Requirement to accumulate 1,095 days of residence in Canada within four years
Evidence_Assessed: Duration of physical presence in Canada
Relief_Sought: Allowance of appeal and remittal for reconsideration
Governing_Rule: Residency requirement under s 5(1)(c) allows for discretion in exceptional circumstances
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of consideration of non-physical presence factors despite sufficient supporting evidence
Outcome: Appeal allowed; case remitted for reconsideration by another judge
Harm_Assessment: Unfair denial of citizenship due to rigid interpretation
Cause_Description: Khan's application was denied despite meeting other criteria because of a 57-day shortfall under a strict physical presence test
Evidence_Handling: Failure to consider contextual evidence beyond days of physical presence
Legal_Provision_Violated: s 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act – improper application
Evidence_Issues: Overreliance on quantitative physical presence without qualitative assessment
Residency_Compliance: Not met under strict test, but potentially met under contextual approach
Decision_Rationale: The judge’s strict application of the physical presence test was unreasonable; a more contextual approach is permitted
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to consider all relevant evidence regarding residency
